00011 // Utility Functions
00012 
00013 double hls_value(double n1, double n2, double hue)
00014 {
00015         if(hue > 360.0) 
00016                 hue -= 360.;
00017         if(hue < 0.0) 
00018                 hue += 360.;
00019         if(hue < 60.) 
00020                 return (n1+(n2-n1)*hue/60.);
00021         if(hue < 180.) 
00022                 return n2;
00023         if(hue < 240.) 
00024                 return (n1+(n2-n1)*(240-hue)/60.);
00025         return n1;
00026 }

00032 CMYUnit::CMYUnit()
00033         : DataspaceUnit("cmy")
00034 {;}
00035 
00036 
00037 CMYUnit::~CMYUnit()
00038 {;}
00039                 
00040 
00041 void CMYUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00042 {
00043         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00044         *(output+0) = 255 - atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0);
00045         *(output+1) = 255 - atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1);
00046         *(output+2) = 255 - atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+2);        
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 void CMYUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00051 {
00052         *outputNumArgs = 3;     
00053         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, 255 - *(input+0));
00054         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, 255 - *(input+1));
00055         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, 255 - *(input+2));
00056 }

00060 HSLUnit::HSLUnit()
00061         : DataspaceUnit("hsl")
00062 {;}
00063 
00064 
00065 HSLUnit::~HSLUnit()
00066 {;}
00067                 
00068                 
00069 void HSLUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00070 {
00071         long    h = atom_getlong(inputAtoms+0);
00072         long    s = atom_getlong(inputAtoms+1);
00073         long    l = atom_getlong(inputAtoms+2);
00074         long    red, green, blue;
00075         double  m1,m2,tr,tg,tb, hue, lightness, saturation;
00076 
00077         // scale to floating point... number range should be 360, 1, 1
00078         hue = (float)h;
00079         //hue = ((hue/255.)*360.);
00080         saturation = (float)s/100.0;
00081         lightness = (float)l/100.0;
00082 
00083         if (lightness <= 0.5) 
00084                 m2 = lightness*(1.0+saturation); 
00085         else 
00086                 m2 = lightness+saturation-lightness*saturation;
00087         m1 = 2.0*lightness-m2;
00088         if (saturation == 0.0){
00089                 tr = lightness;
00090                 tg = lightness;
00091                 tb = lightness;
00092         } 
00093         else{
00094                 tr = hls_value(m1,m2,hue+120.);
00095                 tg = hls_value(m1,m2,hue);
00096                 tb = hls_value(m1,m2,hue-120.);
00097         }
00098         red = (int)(tr*255.);
00099         green = (int)(tg*255.);
00100         blue = (int)(tb*255.);
00101         
00102         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00103         *(output+0) = red;
00104         *(output+1) = green;
00105         *(output+2) = blue;     
00106 }
00107 
00108 
00109 void HSLUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00110 {
00111         long    red = long(*(input+0));
00112         long    green = long(*(input+1));
00113         long    blue = long(*(input+2));
00114         long    hue, lightness, saturation;
00115         double  max,min,delta;
00116         double  r,g,b;
00117         double  H,L,S;
00118         
00119         // first thing, convert them to 0-1
00120         r = red/255.0;
00121         g = green/255.0;
00122         b = blue/255.0;
00123         max = r;
00124         if(max<g)
00125                 max=g;
00126         if(max<b)
00127                 max=b;
00128         min = r;
00129         if (min>g) min=g;
00130         if (min>b) min=b;
00131         L = (max+min)/2.0;
00132         if (max == min){
00133                 S = 0;
00134                 H = 0;
00135         }
00136         else{
00137                 delta = max-min;
00138                 if (L < 0.5) S = delta/(max+min);
00139                 else S = delta/(2.0-max-min);
00140                 if (r == max) H = (g-b)/delta;
00141                 else if (g == max) H = 2.0+(b-r)/delta;
00142                 else if (b == max) H = 4.0+(r-g)/delta;
00143         }
00144         H *= 60.; if (H < 0) H += 360.;
00145         hue = long(H);
00146         saturation = long(S*100.0);
00147         lightness = long(L*100.0);
00148 
00149         *outputNumArgs = 3;     
00150         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, hue);
00151         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, lightness);
00152         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, saturation);
00153 }

00156 /***********************************************************************************************/
00157 HSVUnit::HSVUnit()
00158         : DataspaceUnit("hsv")
00159 {;}
00160 
00161 
00162 HSVUnit::~HSVUnit()
00163 {;}
00164                 
00165                 
00166 void HSVUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00167 {
00168         long    hue = atom_getlong(inputAtoms+0);
00169         long    saturation = atom_getlong(inputAtoms+1);
00170         long    value = atom_getlong(inputAtoms+2);
00171         long    red, green, blue;
00172         double  h,s,v,h1, a[7], tr, tg, tb, q, f;                             
00173 
00174         h = (float)hue;
00175         s = saturation/100.0;
00176         v = value/100.0;
00177         h1 = h;
00178         //q = trunc(h1);
00179 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00180         q = roundf(h1);
00181 #else
00182         q = (long)(h1 + 0.5);
00183 #endif
00184         //q = h1 + 0.49; // round
00185         f = h1-q; 
00186         a[1] = v;
00187         a[2] = v;
00188         a[3] = v*(1-(s*f));
00189         a[4] = v*(1-s);
00190         a[5] = a[4];
00191         a[6] = v*(1-(s*(1-f)));
00192 
00193         if (q > 4) q = q-4;
00194         else q = q+2;
00195         tr=a[(int)q];
00196 
00197         if (q > 4) q = q-4;
00198         else q = q+2;
00199         tb=a[(int)q];
00200 
00201         if (q > 4) q = q-4;
00202         else q = q+2;
00203         tg=a[(int)q];
00204                                 
00205         // output scaling
00206         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00207         *(output+0) = red = (int)(tr*255.);
00208         *(output+1) = green = (int)(tg*255.);
00209         *(output+2) = blue = (int)(tb*255.);    
00210 }
00211 
00212 
00213 void HSVUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00214 {
00215     long    /*i, j, roubitez, pix, red, green, blue,*/ hue, saturation, value;
00216     double      y,h,s,v, r,g,b, r1,g1,b1; 
00217         long    red = long(*(input+0));
00218         long    green = long(*(input+1));
00219         long    blue = long(*(input+2));
00220 
00221         // first thing, convert them to 0-1
00222         r = red/255.0;
00223         g = green/255.0;
00224         b = blue/255.0;
00225         v = r;
00226         
00227         if(v<g)
00228                 v=g;
00229         if(v<b)
00230                 v=b;
00231         y = r;
00232         if(y>g)
00233                 y=g;
00234         if(y>b)
00235                 y=b;
00236         if(v != 0)
00237                 s = (v-y)/v;
00238         else
00239                 s = 0;
00240         if(s == 0){
00241                 hue = 0;
00242                 saturation = 0;
00243                 value = (int)(v*100);
00244                 goto setit;
00245         }               
00246         r1 = (v-r)/(v-y);
00247         g1 = (v-g)/(v-y);
00248         b1 = (v-b)/(v-y);
00249 
00250         if (r == v){
00251                 if(g == y)
00252                         h = 5.+b1;
00253                 else
00254                         h = 1.-g1;
00255         }
00256         else if(g == v){
00257                 if(b == y)
00258                         h = r1+1.;
00259                 else
00260                         h = 3.-b1;
00261         }
00262         else{
00263                 if(r == y)
00264                         h = 3.+g1;
00265                 else
00266                         h = 5.-r1;
00267         }
00268         
00269         // convert it all
00270         h = h * 60.; 
00271         if(h >= 360.)
00272                 h = h-360.;
00273         hue = (int)h;                                   //hue = (int)((h/360.)*255.0);
00274         saturation = (int)(s*100.);             // was 0-1 from the start
00275         value = (int)(v*100.);                  // it was 0-1 from the start
00276 
00277 setit:
00278         *outputNumArgs = 3;     
00279         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, hue);
00280         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, saturation);
00281         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, value);
00282 }

00294                 
00295 void RGBUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00296 {
00297         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00298         *(output+0) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0);
00299         *(output+1) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1);
00300         *(output+2) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+2);      
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00304 void RGBUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00305 {
00306         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00307         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, *(input+0));
00308         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, *(input+1));
00309         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, *(input+2));
00310 }

00312 
00313 /***********************************************************************************************/
00314 ColorDataspace::ColorDataspace()
00315         : DataspaceLib("color", "rgb")
00316 {
00317         // Create one of each kind of unit, and cache them in a hash
00318         registerUnit(new CMYUnit,               gensym("cmy"));
00319         registerUnit(new HSLUnit,               gensym("hsl"));
00320         registerUnit(new HSVUnit,               gensym("hsv"));
00321         registerUnit(new RGBUnit,               gensym("rgb"));
00322         
00323         // Now that the cache is created, we can create a set of default units
00324         setInputUnit(neutralUnit);
00325         setOutputUnit(neutralUnit);
00326 }
00327

00330 {
00331         ;
00332 }
